executive_summary: The Movie Rental Kiosks industry comprises establishments (kiosks) that rent DVDs, Blu-ray discs and video games. Kiosks are stand-alone, automated vending machines generally located near grocery stores and drug stores. Over the five years to 2021, the industry has suffered from a continued decline in demand for physical media as consumers have increasingly adopted digital and online platforms for media viewing. During the period, revenue for the Movie Rental Kiosks industry is estimated to decline an annualized 19.0% to $704.6 million in 2021, including a 3.4% decrease in 2021 alone. Profit is expected to decrease with revenue. The large decrease in revenue is primarily a reflection of the significant decrease in revenue reported by Redbox Automated Retail LLC (Redbox) in 2018. Additionally, the COVID-19 (coronavirus) pandemic is expected to further push down revenue.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Industry comprises DVD, Blu-ray and video game rental kiosks
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: The Movie Rental Kiosks industry comprises establishments (kiosks) that rent DVDs, Blu-ray discs and video games. Kiosks are stand-alone automated vending machines, which are generally located near the entrance of grocery and drug stores.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Declining revenue and profit due to digital competition
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Over the five years to 2021, revenue for the Movie Rental Kiosks industry is estimated to decline an annualized 19.0% to $704.6 million, including an estimated 3.4% decrease in 2021 alone. Industry profit is expected to account for 9.7% of industry revenue in 2021, down from 14.4% in 2016.

The COVID-19 (coronavirus) pandemic is expected to further drive down industry revenue and profit. Consumers in 2020 were increasingly wary about high touch surfaces like rental kiosks due to the pandemic.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Redbox is the primary remaining major player
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Redbox Automated Retail LLC (Redbox) is the only major enterprise remaining in the industry alongside a declining number of small, local operations.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: Continued decline due to streaming adoption
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: The growing adoption of streaming and downloaded video is expected to continue to adversely affect the Movie Rental Kiosks industry over the next five years. Revenue is expected to decline at an annualized rate of 3.6% to $585.5 million in 2026.

In the Movie Rental Kiosks industry, Redbox Automated Retail LLC (Redbox) is expected to remain the primary major player and the number of small, independent operators is expected to continue declining.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: Redbox's on-demand service to help compete
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: Redbox's on-demand rental service is expected to help the company better compete with online streaming and movie rental services moving forward.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: Favorable studio deals to sustain Redbox
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: Redbox's favorable distribution agreements with major motion picture studios is anticipated to solidify the company's position as a provider of new release entertainment.

industry_definition: This industry comprises establishments (kiosks) that rent DVDs, Blu-ray discs and video games from stand-alone, automated vending machines. These kiosks are generally located near the entrance of grocery and drug stores (either inside or outside).

mixed_impact_factors: Barriers To Entry Level: medium - steady

key_trends: The industry has suffered declining revenue due to external competition from companies such as Amazon
Decline in demand for physical entertainment media has driven other companies out of the industry
Redbox has focused on improving its selection of Blu-ray rentals to maintain revenue and profit
Redbox is expected to remain the primary major player moving forward
The industry is projected to be able to sustain fewer kiosk locations due to declining demand
Redbox will continue to be able to set itself apart with its low price point
Heightened external competition has not enabled the industry to sustain other large companies

market_segmentation.segment_description: Households with annual incomes between $50,000 and $100,000 are estimated to account for the largest portion of movie rentals.
Households with annual incomes above $100,000 are estimated to account for 27.6% of total movie rentals.
Households with annual incomes between $30,000 and $50,000 are estimated to account for 24.0% of total movie rentals.
Households with annual incomes below $30,000 account for the smallest share of rentals, at 18.5% in 2021 as they have less money to spend on entertainment.
In 2021, it is estimated that households with children under the age of 18 constitute 64.4% of total movie rentals.
In comparison, households with no children under the age of 18 represent a much smaller share, estimated at 35.6% of rentals in 2021.

products_and_services.product_description: Blu-ray discs are specially designed to store digital optical data that creates images that supersede the visual quality provided by DVDs, delivering an optimal viewing experience.
An estimated 78.5% of revenue for the Movie Rental Kiosks industry is attributable to regular DVD movie rentals.
The sale and rental of video games is estimated to account for 3.5% of total industry revenue in 2021.

tier_1_suppliers: Movie & Video Distribution in the US
Video Game Software Publishing in the US

demand_determinants.determinant_description: Increased competition from relatively new services that serve as direct substitutes to the industry's offerings is reducing demand for physical media rentals.

international_trade_points.trade_description: This industry does not participate in international trade.

business_locations.location_description: The Southeast region accounts for the highest percentage of establishments at 31.1%, followed by the Great Lakes region at 15.5%. This pattern corresponds to the higher population density in these regions.

The Great Lakes is the second-most densely concentrated region, accounting for 15.5% of industry establishments. Large states, such as Ohio, contribute a significant share of storefronts to this region.
The West accounts for about 13.3% of establishments and 17.2% of the population. California, the most populated state in this region, is the region's largest contributor to the industry.
Various locations contributing to industry presence.
Various locations contributing to industry presence.
Various locations contributing to industry presence.
Various locations contributing to industry presence.
Various locations contributing to industry presence.

regulations_points.regulation_description: The industry is subject to copyright provisions on the rental and sale of physical media.
The COVID-19 pandemic increased regulations including social distancing, mask mandates and increased cleaning.

barriers_points.barrier_description: Factors that may prevent or limit a new operator from entering this industry include establishing supply agreements and rising competition from other forms of digital media.
With a high level of capital intensity, barriers to entry are significant and increasing as the rental market is rapidly shrinking.
Supply agreements for newly released films between established Redbox and movie distributors can prevent new companies from entering the industry.

Industry success is highly dependent on location. Movie rental kiosks are typically located in high-traffic sites in grocery stores, retail strips or malls with easy access and parking. Establishing agreements with retailers for kiosk placement can be difficult if other operators are already in place.

basis_points.basis_description: Currently, Redbox is estimated to hold the majority share of the Movie Rental Kiosks industry and thus experiences little to no internal competition as the dominant operator.
Nonetheless, the company experiences a high level of external competition which is driving a decline in demand for industry services.

The industry's greatest sources of competition are mail-delivery and online services such as Netflix, HBONow, Amazon and iTunes; traditional television and movie programmers such as HBO and Showtime; traditional brick-and-mortar retailers; other video game rental providers such as GameFly; cable, satellite and telecommunications providers such as Comcast; and general competition from other forms of entertainment such as movie theaters, television and sporting events.

Movie rental kiosks were once seen as the most convenient, low-cost and up-to-date resources for movies and video games. However, the home video distribution market continues to evolve rapidly in favor of more convenient and faster digital platforms. As a result, industry operators have experienced a decline in the physical rental market as they have competed with newer technologies and distribution channels for consumer entertainment.

concentration_points.concentration_description: The Movie Rental Kiosks industry has a high level of market share concentration. Redbox, now owned by privately held Apollo Global Management, is the largest operator in the Movie Rental Kiosks industry, with an estimated market share of 70.7% in 2021.

Demand for physical movie rentals has rapidly declined as digital and on-demand rentals have emerged as more convenient options. As a result, the number of companies operating in the industry has rapidly declined, contributing to Redbox's high market share and the high level of market concentration.

Moreover, other companies in the industry are small, operating on a very localized basis and may only operate a small number of kiosks. With declining demand, it is unlikely these companies will expand their locations and thus increase their market share.

cost_factors.cost_factor_description: Purchase costs are the largest expense for the industry, accounting for an estimated 8.8% of revenue in 2021.

cost_factors.cost_factor_title: Rent costs as percentage of revenue
cost_factors.cost_factor_description: Rent costs are estimated to account for 9.5% of total revenue in 2021.
Other costs include administrative costs, repairs and maintenance, and research and development.

capital_intensity_points.capital_intensity_description: For every $1.00 spent on labor, industry operators are estimated to spend $3.56 on capital investments.

volatility_points.volatility_description: Revenue has been volatile due to a combination of declining demand and the removal of underperforming kiosks.
In some years, although revenue declines have been a constant, growth rates have varied significantly.

technological_change_points.technological_change_description: Kiosk technology has remained relatively the same over the past five years, with slight variations in payment and mobile systems.
Streaming services and digital rentals have made physical rentals obsolete and inconvenient.

FAQs.question: Does your company specialize in one corner of the market or do you retail a diversified range of products?
FAQs.answer: Redbox, currently the industry's only major player specializes in movie and DVD rentals. In addition, while each kiosk stocks up to 200 titles, the company puts a focus on providing the newest release films.

FAQs.question: Are your company's prices competitive with both direct competitors and alternative forms of entertainment?
FAQs.answer: Redbox remains one of the lowest cost forms of entertainment, providing lower cost rentals compared to Amazon and iTunes rentals. In addition, Redbox rentals are much lower compared to the cost of attending a sporting event, concert or movie in theaters.

FAQs.question: If your company benefits from population density, are you located in high traffic areas to increase your exposure?
FAQs.answer: Redbox kiosks located in densely populated areas typically generate higher revenue through more rentals due to higher traffic and more exposure.

FAQs.question: Has your company explored acquisition opportunities in order to expand reach and reduce overhead expenses?
FAQs.answer: Redbox became the primary operator in this industry by acquiring its major competitor NCR Corporation in 2012, enabling it to expand its reach and market share.

FAQs.question: Has your company explored lowering wage costs through part-time labor and automation via point-of-sale systems?
FAQs.answer: Wages for Redbox, the industry's largest company, constitute less than 5.0% of revenue because all movie rentals are conducted through their automated kiosks or website. Labor is only used for auxiliary functions such as machine repair and inventory upgrades.

FAQs.question: Has your company integrated web and mobile reservation and appointment systems to improve consumer accessibility?
FAQs.answer: Redbox has recently launched its On-Demand movie rental service, which is still in public beta. Movies can be rented or purchases on-demand through the company's website or mobile app. This has increased the methods by which customers can access Redbox's services.

FAQs.question: Are you up-to-date with legislative and regulatory changes that may allow your company to expand into new markets?
FAQs.answer: There are no regulations directly relevant to the industry. However, Redbox must receive permission from retailers in order to place kiosks at their establishments. Also, Redbox must obtain licensing rights from the respective studios that produced the films in order to rent them to customers.

FAQs.question: How do licensing agreements with major studios affect your business?
FAQs.answer: The contracts with major studios influence when Redbox is permitted to begin renting out new release films, whose availability drives demand for movies. In addition, the licensing agreements also affect the level of profit by setting a percentage of revenue that Redbox must pay to the studios.

FAQs.question: How can you maintain superior service while reducing operating costs?
FAQs.answer: To provide superior service to customers and improve operating efficiencies, Redbox has relocated kiosks to areas with higher demand, which has helped minimize operating costs. In addition, the company operates a customer service line.

FAQs.question: How does your company plan for and finance large capital expenditures, as well as additions and renovations to existing infrastructure?
FAQs.answer: The largest capital expenditures for Redbox are their automated kiosks, where customers can rent entertainment. These kiosks must be purchased, removed, and relocated periodically. In addition, Redbox is continually focusing on the research and development of such kiosks and their software.

FAQs.question: With which studios and publishers do you have distribution agreements? How could you accumulate more?
FAQs.answer: Multi-year contracts with top film studios are critical to maintain an up-to-date supply of film titles within kiosk inventories.

FAQs.question: What do you do to promote loyalty and to keep your customers returning for follow-up visits? How easy is it to use your kiosks?
FAQs.answer: Maintaining consistent markets and loyal customers is important for establishing steady revenue flow. In 2020, keeping kiosks clean and sanitized became increasingly important due to the COVID-19 (coronavirus) pandemic.

FAQs.question: What systems do you use to track rented inventory? Do you incur losses from un-returned merchandise?
FAQs.answer: An operator's ability to manage debts from late returns of rented products is important to maintaining assets, and keeping track of accumulated fees from customers that lose or keep rented products for an extended period.

FAQs.question: How do your prices and selection compare with those of video streaming services? Are there any ways you could price more competitively?
FAQs.answer: The increasing amount of alternative media is driving a decline in demand for rentals of physical media. Instead of renting physical entertainment media, consumers are choosing instead to view media entertainment using streaming platforms and on-demand digital rentals.

FAQs.question: Does the overall level of consumer spending affect demand for your industry? How do you stimulate demand when spending is low?
FAQs.answer: During economic downturns, the inevitable spike in unemployment leads to declining consumption. When consumer spending is high, consumers will be more likely to spend money on discretionary purchases, like movie rentals. In 2021, consumer spending is expected to increase. This follows a decrease in 2020 due to the COVID-19 (coronavirus) pandemic.

FAQs.question: Does the level of population density generate higher revenue or improve the efficiency of your operations? How popular is your company in cities?
FAQs.answer: Over the past five years, more people have been shifting to metro areas, creating more densely populated areas with higher foot traffic. This benefits industry operators, as exposure remains a major basis of competition within the industry. In 2021, the urban population is expected to increase.
